intro: Anthospermum basuticum, commonly known as the Basutu starflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its star-shaped, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It has small, elliptical leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stems. Anthospermum basuticum is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate floral display.
